title: Why has Rammus received so many nerfs?
body:
Going over his history it seems like the only buffs he ever has gotten were basically QoL (q/w forms crossover a bit now similar to udyr) and mana on ult was reduced to 100 (part of the great ultmanareducining patch)

Other than that
**
Q (Roll)** - CD increased, damage decreased, Slow magnitude and duration decreased

**W (Curl) **- Armor/MR granted decreased, Return damage decreased (multiple times), Return damage scaling decreased, Armor removal on enemy attackers decreased to negligible levels (5-25 armor flat... really)

**E (Taunt)** - Duration Decreased, Cooldown Increased

**R (Ult)** - Damage per Second decreased (though ratio was raised from 20% - 30%) So nerf to tank rammus buff to ap rammus...

----------------------------------------------------------------

Am I missing something here? I feel like I've only ever seen him in competitive play once, people have laughed at me for picking him for 4+ seasons because he's so unpopular (he's not awful, he's just unheard of at near galio levels)

Armor/MR doesn't even seem to matter as much anymore as everyone tears straight through it, or with later champs has some form of true damage, natural armor pen, or dashes/hops out the a$$...

So why all the hate on Rammus? I feel like he did something to someones family at riot that just was not OK and the vengeance bat has never been let go since.

You have to remember, ADC's control the balance in this game, they are the ones who whine the most whenever something is strong against them. And they whine so much, good old Uncle Rito nerfs the hell out of it and says, "It's okay ADC mains, we know most of you aren't that intelligent and only know how to right click. I'm not sure why I even need to emphasize this. They are called ADCs or Attack Damage **Carries**. Now if you realize this. The entire game is about focusing the ADC as a team no matter what side you are on. Keep alive or kill the ADC. If the ADC is dying or staying alive your team isn't going to be having fun. Have you ever seen a team fight with the lack of people with raw damage to fight in a sustained fight. It's extremely awkward and leads to a really long fight that may not even progress the game. It looks like two teams smacking each other with wet noodles until there are only tanks left and then its just 2 fat people struggling to see who can live to force 5v4 when their team gets up. The ADC prevents the awkward really long team fights and helps allow you to push after they are over.

Point is the ADC is always the solution late game. And the way this game plays. Late game is almost always achieved its just the skill levels that make the difference.

ADC's do not control the game, they shine more late game, but in the end, the better team will usually win. Does an ADC help? Yes, but by no means are they required to play this game, to make it fun.

I agree with you with about every champion on that list except for Diana and Rek'Sai. Can you explain those two for me? I actually find Xin to be _annoying_, but not _broken_. However, Diana is just as _toxic_ as any other assassin if you ask me, and Rek'Sai (I have not tried her so this is just an opinion) looks relatively balanced and fair to fight against in the jungle, as well as in team fights, especially since something happened recently that made it harder for her to build just flat out damage, and now most Rek'Sai seem to go tanky instead.

The problem with Diana jungle is that it bypasses her biggest weakness, her early game. She farms up to a point and then comes out and pentakills your team. She is like Riven, deceptively tanky with insane burst. 

As for Rek'Sai, no weaknesses at all until she falls off a little in the late game, and even then she is still very useful. She has the highest mobility of any jungler, does great damage early and mid game, can gank level 2, is tanky, has sustain, long poke, an AoE knockup, and tremor sense on top of all that! I honestly have NEVER won a 1v1 against a Rek'Sai whether it was jungle or top lane, and this is with multiple champions that I am good with. I'm sure people will say "you just suck" but I don't have a major problem against ANY other champ in the game.

But Lugg, I have one question for you: How is she different than Akali?

Rek'Sai I don't use myself, so my opinion is invalid from the get-go. However, often times when I fight against a Rek'Sai, even when they are fed, they fall off so hard late game it's as bad as Darius. Her team fighting is appalling, regardless of whether or not they build tanky, and I don't know why!!

Diana and Akali are similar, but Diana has better CC, a shield, and no CD on her ult. As long as her Q or passive proc she has unlimited ults. Plus she does more AoE damage. 

Rek'sai falls off some late game but is still useful as a meat shield, poke, and vision from tremor sense.
